intro: Echidnopsis inconspicua, commonly known as the Ghost Ghostflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pale green or white, which help it blend into its desert environment. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with minimal water requirements. Echidnopsis inconspicua is often found growing on rocky outcrops and in sandy soils, where it thrives in full sun.
